content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The idea is nice, the code is not that easy to solve and requires a little thought

The way you output (x,y) and (y,x) doesn't matter. It is easy to change this way depending on your own reference.
Good puzzle ! Good job !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle. Clear and simple, good for clash.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good  to me. Searching in y,x order but printing x,y may throw some people off at first (guilty), but it's a perfectly reasonable output format for the problem.

Yea, I was thinking about it too. Printing anything else than x,y seems off, but requiring the order in x,y means a different order than how it is parsed. It would be best not to require any order at all, but that cannot be achieved here :(

Anyway, if there's one more comment that it would be better to sort by x,y, I'll change it.

Thanks for the comment!
